intro: Rhytiglossa pedunculosa, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. The plant is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in a fine pubescence. Rhytiglossa pedunculosa thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
